intro: Daucus bactrianus, commonly known as the Bactrian carrot, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and dill. The plant produces yellow flowers and has a taproot that is often used as a vegetable. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Daucus bactrianus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
